thread.title: Air New Zealand resumes Bali flights
thread.title_full: Air New Zealand resumes Bali flights

author: John Anthony
title: Air New Zealand resumes Bali flights
text:
Air New Zealand resumes Bali flights JOHN ANTHONY Last updated 12:50, August 11 2015 Agung Parameswara 
Some tourists have been stuck in Bali since Wednesday when an ash cloud began affecting flights. 
A special Air New Zealand flight has departed for Denpasar Airport to pick up hundreds of tourists who have been stranded in Bali for nearly a week. 
About 350 New Zealanders are stuck in Bali after airlines started cancelling flights in and out of Denpasar Airport on Wednesday due to dangerous flying conditions caused by an ash cloud from Mt Raung in East Java. 
READ MORE: 350 New Zealanders stranded in Bali 
Air Zealand flight NZ245 departed for Bali at 10am on Tuesday as a wind shift blows the ash cloud away from Bali's Denpasar Airport. 
Air New Zealand said indications showed favourable operating conditions for its services in and out of Denpasar on Tuesday and Wednesday but warned passengers that could change. 
"As conditions are changeable, please note these services will continue to depend on our ability to operate safely in and out of Denpasar," it said in a statement. 
The special return service NZ246 was expected to depart Bali at 6.20pm on Tuesday and arrive in Auckland on Wednesday at 6.25am. 
Air New Zealand spokeswoman Nicole O'Brien said many passengers were choosing to delay their travel or head to another destination. 
Customers with tickets issued on or before August 5 for travel to or from Denpasar were being given the option to change to a later departure date on an Air New Zealand flight on or before August 29 without penalty. 
The value of the ticket may also be held in credit for payment towards travel within 12 months. 
Alternatively customers may change to another Air New Zealand destination without penalty. 
Customers who no longer chose to travel may apply for a refund without penalty. - Stuff
